text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen I'm 
making what's called laab Tod which means

deep-fried laab laab as many of you know is a 
salad made of ground meat and lots of herbs

and spices it's sour it's spicy super good turn 
it into meatballs that I'm gonna deep fry and

make it crispy and Munchie let's get started a 
signature ingredient of laughs is cow kueh or

toasted rice powder sticky rice in the pan you 
can use jasmine rice as well but traditionally

we use Thai sticky rice turn the heat on some 
kaffir lime leaves toast the lime leaves right

in with the rice so it becomes toasted rice 
powder with extra aromatics in it and just

get rid of this step you want to keep stirring 
you can crank the heats pretty high on this as

long as you keep it moving color is exactly what 
I'm looking for and you should smell the toasty

aroma in the air and the lime leaves are now 
crispy so now I can grind everything into nice

aromatic powder I've transferred the rice into a 
heavy-duty morton pestle you can also use a coffee

grinder if you'd like and just grind it into a 
powder there that's what I'm looking for a nice

fine powder little chunks are okay adds a little 
crunch this is toasted rice powder with a little

attitude now the easiest part ground pork don't 
go with lean you want a little bit of fat to keep

everything lubricated and the ingredients that 
go in are pretty much the exact same things as

if you were to make a regular lap pour all my rice 
powder into here I know this looks like a lot but

it'll also help tenderize the meat balls a little 
bit as well minced galangal going in got some

lemongrass make sure they're not in big chunks 
mmm it smells like laughs already and shallots

add a little onion a bite cilantro don't throw 
out the stems make sure you include the stems

in there another important urban lattice sawtooth 
coriander here they are they're long leaves I've

got jagged Edge's and they smell sort of halfway 
between cilantro and mint we always put this in

lab but I know it's hard to find here so if you 
don't have it that's okay but if you can find

it big bonus and now all the seasoning fish sauce 
lots of lime juice sour is the main flavor of lab

there's no such thing as a lab that is not spicy 
chilies of course there you go just mix it all up

and I like to make sure everything is really well 
distributed by just getting in there with my hands

and give it a little love making meatballs when 
I make clap meatballs I like to make them not so

perfectly round and smooth keep it loose keep it 
a little rough around the edges and those rough

edges are what's gonna get crispy now of course 
if at this point you want to taste the mix cook

up a little bit in a microwave and taste it 
frying time super simple hot oil 350 degrees

move them around a bit in the beginning because 
they like to stick just give them a little nudge

you see a lot of little bits loose shallots and 
things like that floating around this is why I

like to have one of these get rid of them 
because those fits are gonna just continue

to burn and then muck up your oil faster than 
necessary see all these jagged edges that's why

we didn't form our ball so tight and smooth 
and round those are the crispy bits right

there if you've got the temperature right the 
outside will be a nice dark brown color we're

not going for a light gold round here if the 
color looks right the inside should be good

these are done they are looking crispy and see 
all these bits of rice powder that's sticking

out that is what makes laps so unique and 
delicious you can eat these on their own

if you want they're really addictive with a 
glass of beer what a great afternoon however

what I like to do is like I like to make 
a little rap with a little mint and some

lettuce because lab is always served with mint 
I don't like to cook min because when you cook

mint it loses its bright fresh coolness look at 
the inside so moist and juicy so I'm gonna take

a little piece of lettuce a little piece of 
mint and a little piece of my lap meatballs

it's so addictive it's just it's got that 
bar snack addictive quality but the lettuce

and the mint keeps it fresh when it's nice out 
and you've got some cold beer think about laps

hot what a great way also to serve this at a 
party people will be storming this plate the

recipe as always it's on hot item calm when 
you do give this a try send me a photo on

Facebook Twitter Instagram I love seeing your 
photos and next time for your next delicious
